answers.text: The Great Basin and Columbia Plateau

qas.question: What is the precipitation average in the Intermontane plateaus?
In the southwest, how high do temperatures get?

plausible_answers.text: monsoon from the Gulf of California

qas.question: The Southeast and great basin are affected by what?
Monsoons bring widespread what to the region?

context: <a0_0>The Great Basin and <b5_0>Columbia Plateau<b5_0/><a0_0/> (the Intermontane Plateaus) are arid or semiarid regions that lie in the rain shadow of the Cascades and Sierra Nevada. Precipitation averages less than <a1_0><b6_0>15 inches<b6_0/><a1_0/> (38 cm). The Southwest is a hot desert, with temperatures exceeding <a2_0><b7_0>100 °F (37.8 °C)<b7_0/><a2_0/> for several weeks at a time in summer. The Southwest and the Great Basin are also affected by the <b8_0>monsoon from the Gulf of California<b8_0/> from <a3_0>July to September<a3_0/>, which brings localized but often <a4_0>severe <b9_0>thunderstorms<b9_0/><a4_0/> to the region.
